docs.lead_paragraph: Companies that sell disability insurance to individuals are reporting a sharp rise in claims for certain ailments that were little known 10 years ago, leaving the insurers with losses of hundreds of millions of dollars. The companies are also reporting a big increase in claims by doctors, once among the most prized of the insurance industry's clients. In response, insurers are adopting new strategies, from offering less generous benefits to pulling out of the business. Three million people, many of them self-employed, are covered by individual disability policies that generate annual revenues for insurers of $3.5 billion. Group disability policies offered through employers cover 48 million more people, and offer more limited benefits.
